baseline.title: Visionary
baseline.Psychological Profile: You lead by pointing the horizon. You move with speed that’s anchored to an image of what could be — decisions are judged by whether they advance a future that matters. Your authority is persuasive because it carries meaning, not just order.
baseline.Origin: You learned the cost of short-sighted wins when missions lost their purpose. After seeing bright sprints collapse larger aims, you trained yourself to hold the helm with a long arc in mind so each move stacks toward a coherent destination.
baseline.Inner Conflict: You push for progress while guarding the future. The tension is between urgent wins and commitments that take time to pay off; you often delay satisfying moves that would fracture the long view you’re stewarding.
baseline.Field Presence: People rally because they can see a destination. Your calls feel generative; followers trade patience for purpose. The downside: in the short term you can seem distant or abstract when others want immediate fixes. Signal: Future pulls the present.

variants.title: Visionary × Sovereign
variants.Psychological Profile: You fuse horizon and command. You point a future clearly and insist the team move toward it; your authority frames what counts as progress, turning vision into executable calls.
variants.Origin: You saw leaders who dreamed but never landed. You learned to couple sight with firm direction so a long arc doesn’t become vapor but becomes a ship you can steer.
variants.Inner Conflict: You wrestle with whether to demand quick alignment or let ideas evolve. Pushing too hard can collapse the craftsmanship needed to realize the vision; being too patient can let momentum die.
variants.Field Presence: People follow because your future is clear and commanded. Your presence feels like a destination with a map; skeptics may call it rigid, but it gets things built. Signal: Commanded horizon compels.

variants.title: Visionary × Rebel
variants.Psychological Profile: You imagine a different future and then tear down the barriers that keep it from arriving. Your vision demands rupture when the old is ossified; you won’t wait for consensus to catch up with possibility.
variants.Origin: You watched complacency preserve dead systems. You learned that some futures require bold disruption, so you pair imagination with tactics that break what blocks progress.
variants.Inner Conflict: You balance constructive demolition with stewardship of the path forward. The risk is that breaking too fast scatters the resources the vision needs to land.
variants.Field Presence: Your energy feels both prophetic and insurgent: people see a future and a path through fire. Some are energized; others fear the cost. Signal: Break toward horizon.

variants.title: Visionary × Navigator
variants.Psychological Profile: You envision the destination and map the route. Your visions come with coordinates: you not only cast a goal but lay out the constraints, milestones, and tradeoffs that make it reachable.
variants.Origin: You learned that grand ideas die without practical paths. So you trained yourself to test assumptions against terrain and to turn ambition into actionable routes.
variants.Inner Conflict: You can get bogged down in planning the path and miss the pulse to move. The tension is between charting a durable route and seizing fleeting opportunities.
variants.Field Presence: Teams feel inspired and guided: they can see where they’re headed and how to get there. Your specificity calms risk-averse stakeholders but can slow impulsive actors. Signal: Mapped future guides.

variants.title: Visionary × Equalizer
variants.Psychological Profile: You hold a future that includes everyone. Your vision filters success by who benefits; you push for outcomes that widen access rather than concentrate gain.
variants.Origin: You saw futures that profited a few and left many behind. You learned to insist that the picture you chase distributes value, not just prestige.
variants.Inner Conflict: You slow when a shortcut benefits a narrow group. The moral weight of inclusion can delay moves that look expedient but would fracture the long-term social fabric.
variants.Field Presence: People trust your vision when fairness matters: it promises a future they can belong to. Critics call it slow; those it protects call it necessary. Signal: Inclusive future endures.

variants.title: Visionary × Guardian
variants.Psychological Profile: You imagine a future that keeps people safe. Your vision prioritizes survivability and resilience, favoring pathways that protect the crew as the system grows.
variants.Origin: You watched ambitious plans eat people. You learned to design futures that can be lived in and that preserve the team through transition.
variants.Inner Conflict: You wrestle with how much risk the vision can bear. Pushing for scale too fast can expose people to harm; moving too cautiously can let the opportunity vanish.
variants.Field Presence: Colleagues sense a caring ambition: a future that is both bold and survivable. You temper loftier claims with checks that preserve the team. Signal: Resilient future protects.

variants.title: Visionary × Seeker
variants.Psychological Profile: You search for evidence that validates the arc. Your vision requires signals that show the path is real; you test assumptions so the horizon isn’t wishful thinking.
variants.Origin: You saw noble plans collapse because they lacked proof. You trained to vet ideas early so the future you chase has a backbone of real data.
variants.Inner Conflict: You delay glamour for proof, which sometimes slows momentum. The trade is between convincing imagination and convincing evidence.
variants.Field Presence: Your combination of sight and tests reassures pragmatic teams. People either gain confidence in the future or feel stalled while you vet it. Signal: Evidence steadies vision.

variants.title: Visionary × Architect
variants.Psychological Profile: You dream systems and then design them. Your vision comes with blueprints: you imagine structures that let the future scale without falling apart.
variants.Origin: You saw beautiful plans fail under complexity. You learned to combine imagination with principled design so aspiration can grow without collapsing.
variants.Inner Conflict: You battle between elegant design and market speed. The urge to perfect systems can slow launch windows the organization can’t afford to miss.
variants.Field Presence: People trust that your visions will survive scaling. You build confidence by mapping how the future actually functions, though some call it overengineering. Signal: Blueprint secures future.

variants.title: Visionary × Spotlight
variants.Psychological Profile: You make the future visible. Your vision works by lighting a compelling image that attracts attention and resources; you know that visibility accelerates adoption.
variants.Origin: You saw good ideas die because they were invisible. You learned to craft a picture that people can’t ignore so momentum follows the attention.
variants.Inner Conflict: You wrestle with spectacle versus substance. Making something hot can attract fat margins but also hollow imitation if the core isn’t solid.
variants.Field Presence: Under your lead, rooms mobilize toward an attractive north star. People feel momentum; skeptics warn that glow can outpace grounding. Signal: Attention accelerates adoption.

variants.title: Visionary × Diplomat
variants.Psychological Profile: You build a future everyone can sign onto. Your vision is translated into languages different stakeholders can live with; you design frames that hold coalitions together.
variants.Origin: You saw fragmentation derail good plans. You learned to shape futures that stick across interests so alignment becomes a durable asset, not a brittle accord.
variants.Inner Conflict: You slow to preserve the coalition, which can dilute boldness. The question is whether a watered-down future that everyone accepts is better than a purer future with fewer allies.
variants.Field Presence: People feel held by your inclusive framing: the future becomes a shared project. It lands more often, though sometimes smaller than the boldest visionaries want. Signal: Framed future gains allies.

variants.title: Visionary × Partner
variants.Psychological Profile: You imagine a future that preserves relationships. Your vision moves people because it promises shared care; you prioritize outcomes that keep bonds intact as the system evolves.
variants.Origin: You watched ambition sever teams. You learned to pursue futures that sustain the people who must build them, not only the markets they serve.
variants.Inner Conflict: You temper radical leaps to avoid breaking the social fabric. Sometimes that restraint costs speed, but it often preserves the ability to see the project through.
variants.Field Presence: Teams follow because they feel the future won’t abandon them. Your stewardship binds commitment and reduces burnouts. Signal: Caring future retains teams.

variants.title: Visionary × Provider
variants.Psychological Profile: You envision futures that are funded and feasible. Your plans account for provisioning and sustainability; you refuse loftiness that can’t be resourced.
variants.Origin: You watched dreams starve when leaders chased glory without means. You learned to pair ambition with provisioning so ideas actually happen.
variants.Inner Conflict: You delay visions until the runway exists, which can look like conservatism. The trade-off is between financed viability and raw inventiveness.
variants.Field Presence: People move because the future feels realistic and supplied. Your approach makes adoption more likely, even if it takes longer to assemble. Signal: Funded future launches.

variants.title: Visionary × Catalyst
variants.Psychological Profile: You design futures that flip inertia. Your vision seeks leverage points and minimal moves that create cascades, preferring catalytic shifts over gradualism.
variants.Origin: You saw slow drift eat opportunity. You learned to identify high-leverage interventions that force a new trajectory instead of incremental tinkering.
variants.Inner Conflict: You pick moves that can be disruptive; sometimes the burn is necessary, sometimes it’s costly. You weigh dramatic change against the moral and practical cost.
variants.Field Presence: Around you, systems reorient quickly; your visions often arrive because small changes create outsized movement. The risk is that some get burned en route. Signal: Leverage flips inertia.

variants.title: Visionary × Artisan
variants.Psychological Profile: You craft futures by refining detail. Your vision is realized through excellence of execution — you prove the future by making it sing at a human scale.
variants.Origin: You watched sloppy launches cheapen big ideas. You learned to prototype, test, and perfect so the long-term picture actually survives the first hard test.
variants.Inner Conflict: You polish until the moment passes. The dilemma is fidelity versus timing: too much craft can delay the very future it promises.
variants.Field Presence: People trust that your visions will hold because they’ve been built with care. Your approach wins durability at the cost of some speed. Signal: Crafted future endures.
